event.title: was incorporated from the towns of Pomfret, Brooklyn, Canterbury, Mansfield, and Windham in 1786

data.event: It was incorporated from the towns of Pomfret, Brooklyn, Canterbury, Mansfield, and Windham in 1786.
Also preserved is "The House the Women Built," a 2-story building built in 1776 by Sally Bowers and other young women of the town while the men fought in the Continental Army.

event.title: added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1982

data.event: Hampton Hill Historic District - added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1982.

event.title: added to the National Register of Historic Places in 2007

data.event: Hemlock Glen Industrial Archeological District - added to the National Register of Historic Places in 2007.
